next_bounty(chain)¶

Override this to implement different bounty submission queues

Parameters:chain (str) – Chain we are operating on
Returns:Tuple of amount, ipfs_uri, duration, None to terminate submission

amount (int): Amount to place this bounty for ipfs_uri (str): IPFS URI of the artifact to post duration (int): Duration of the bounty in blocks
Return type:(int, str, int)
on_bounty_posted(guid, amount, ipfs_uri, expiration, chain)¶

Override this to implement additional steps after bounty submission

Parameters:
  • guid (str) – GUID of the posted bounty
  • amount (int) – Amount of the posted bounty
  • ipfs_uri (str) – URI of the artifact submitted
  • expiration (int) – Block number of bounty expiration
  • chain (str) – Chain we are operating on

Arbiter¶

class polyswarmclient.arbiter.Arbiter(client, testing=0, scanner=None, chains={'home'})¶

Bases: object

classmethod connect(polyswarmd_addr, keyfile, password, api_key=None, testing=0, insecure_transport=False, scanner=None, chains={'home'})¶
handle_new_bounty(guid, author, amount, uri, expiration, chain)¶

Scan and assert on a posted bounty

Parameters:
  • guid (str) – The bounty to assert on
  • author (str) – The bounty author
  • amount (str) – Amount of the bounty in base NCT units (10 ^ -18)
  • uri (str) – IPFS hash of the root artifact
  • expiration (str) – Block number of the bounty’s expiration
  • chain (str) – Is this on the home or side chain?
Returns:

Response JSON parsed from polyswarmd containing placed assertions
handle_run(chain)¶
handle_settle_bounty(bounty_guid, chain)¶
handle_vote_on_bounty(bounty_guid, verdicts, valid_bloom, chain)¶
run()¶
scan(guid, content, chain)¶

Override this to implement custom scanning logic

Parameters:
  • guid (str) – GUID of the bounty under analysis, use to track artifacts in the same bounty
  • content (bytes) – Content of the artifact to be scan
  • chain (str) – Chain we are operating on
Returns:

Tuple of bit, verdict, metadata

bit (bool): Whether to include this artifact in the assertion or not verdict (bool): Whether this artifact is malicious or not metadata (str): Optional metadata about this artifact
Return type:

(bool, bool, str)

  • index (int) – Index of the assertion
  • chain (str) – Which chain to operate on

Parameters:chain (str) – Which chain to operate on

post_assertion(bounty_guid, bid, mask, verdicts, chain='home')¶

Post an assertion to polyswarmd

Parameters:
  • bounty_guid (str) – The bounty to assert on
  • bid (int) – The amount to bid
  • mask (List[bool]) – Which artifacts in the bounty to assert on
  • verdicts (List[bool]) – Verdict (malicious/benign) for each of the artifacts in the bounty
  • chain (str) – Which chain to operate on
Returns:

Response JSON parsed from polyswarmd containing emitted events
post_bounty(amount, artifact_uri, duration, chain='home')¶

Post a bounty to polyswarmd

Parameters:
  • amount (int) – The amount to put up as a bounty
  • artifact_uri (str) – URI of artifacts
  • duration (int) – Number of blocks to accept new assertions
  • chain (str) – Which chain to operate on
Returns:

Response JSON parsed from polyswarmd containing emitted events
post_reveal(bounty_guid, index, nonce, verdicts, metadata, chain='home')¶

Post an assertion reveal to polyswarmd

Parameters:
  • bounty_guid (str) – The bounty which we have asserted on
  • index (int) – The index of the assertion to reveal
  • nonce (str) – Secret nonce used to reveal assertion
  • verdicts (List[bool]) – Verdict (malicious/benign) for each of the artifacts in the bounty
  • metadata (str) – Optional metadata
  • chain (str) – Which chain to operate on
Returns:

Response JSON parsed from polyswarmd containing emitted events
post_vote(bounty_guid, verdicts, valid_bloom, chain='home')¶

Post a bounty to polyswarmd

Parameters:
  • bounty_guid (str) – The bounty which we are voting on
  • verdicts (List[bool]) – Verdict (malicious/benign) for each of the artifacts in the bounty
  • valid_bloom (bool) – Is the bloom filter reported by the bounty poster valid
  • chain (str) – Which chain to operate on
Returns:

Response JSON parsed from polyswarmd containing emitted events
settle_bounty(bounty_guid, chain='home')¶

Settle a bounty via polyswarmd

Parameters:
  • bounty_guid (str) – The bounty which we are settling
  • chain (str) – Which chain to operate on
Returns:

Response JSON parsed from polyswarmd containing emitted events

run(guid, ambassador, expert, multi_signature)¶

Run the registered callbacks

Parameters:
  • guid (str) – GUID of the channel
  • ambassador (str) – Address of the ambassador
  • expert (str) – Address of the expert
  • msig (str) – Address of the multi sig contract
  • chain (str) – Chain event received on
class polyswarmclient.events.OnNewAssertionCallback¶

Bases: polyswarmclient.events.Callback

Called upon receiving a new assertion

run(bounty_guid, author, index, bid, mask, commitment, chain)¶

Run the registered callbacks

Parameters:
  • bounty_guid (str) – Bounty GUID
  • author (str) – Author of the assertion
  • index (int) – Index of the assertion within the bounty
  • mask (List[bool]) – Bitmask indicating which artifacts are being asserted on
  • commitment (int) – Commitment hash representing the assertion’s confidential verdicts
  • chain (str) – Chain event received on

class polyswarmclient.events.OnRevealAssertionCallback¶

Bases: polyswarmclient.events.Callback

Called upon receiving a new assertion reveal

run(bounty_guid, author, index, nonce, verdicts, metadata, chain)¶

Run the registered callbacks

Parameters:
  • bounty_guid (str) – Bounty GUID
  • author (str) – Author of the assertion
  • index (int) – Index of the assertion within the bounty
  • nonce (int) – Nonce used to calculate the commitment hash for this assertion
  • verdicts (List[bool]) – Bitmask indicating malicious or benign verdicts for each artifact
  • metadata (str) – Optional metadata for this assertion
  • chain (str) – Chain event received on

  • index (int) – Index of the assertion to reveal
  • nonce (str) – Secret nonce used to reveal assertion
  • verdicts (List[bool]) – List of verdicts for each artifact in the bounty
  • metadata (str) – Optional metadata
  • chain (str) – Chain event received on

bid(guid, chain)¶

Override this to implement custom bid calculation logic

Parameters:
  • guid (str) – GUID of the bounty under analysis, use to correlate with artifacts in the same bounty
  • chain (str) – Chain we are operating on
Returns:

Amount of NCT to bid in base NCT units (10 ^ -18)
Return type:

(int)

Scan and assert on a posted bounty

Parameters:
  • guid (str) – The bounty to assert on
  • author (str) – The bounty author
  • amount (str) – Amount of the bounty in base NCT units (10 ^ -18)
  • uri (str) – IPFS hash of the root artifact
  • expiration (str) – Block number of the bounty’s expiration
  • chain (str) – Is this on the home or side chain?

Bases: object

get_artifact(ipfs_uri, index)¶

Retrieve an artifact from IPFS via polyswarmd

Parameters:
  • ipfs_uri (str) – IPFS hash of the artifact to retrieve
  • index (int) – Index of the sub artifact to retrieve
Returns:

Content of the artifact
Return type:

(bytes)
get_artifacts(ipfs_uri)¶
list_artifacts(ipfs_uri)¶
listen_for_events(chain='home')¶

Listen for events via websocket connection to polyswarmd

Parameters:chain (str) – Which chain to operate on
make_request(method, path, chain, json=None, track_nonce=False)¶

Make a request to polyswarmd, expecting a json response

Parameters:
  • method (str) – HTTP method to use
  • path (str) – Path portion of URI to send request to
  • chain (str) – Which chain to operate on
  • json (obj) – JSON payload to send with request
  • track_nonce (bool) – Whether to track generated transaction and update nonce
Returns:

Response JSON parsed from polyswarmd
post_artifacts(files)¶

Post artifacts to polyswarmd, flexible files parameter to support different use-cases

Parameters:files (list[(filename, contents)]) – The artifacts to upload, accepts one of: (filename, bytes): File name and contents to upload (filename, file_obj): (Optional) file name and file object to upload (filename, None): File name to open and upload
Returns:IPFS URI of the uploaded artifact
Return type:(str)
post_transactions(transactions, chain='home')¶

Post a set of (signed) transactions to Ethereum via polyswarmd, parsing the emitted events

Parameters:
  • transactions (List[Transaction]) – The transactions to sign and post
  • chain (str) – Which chain to operate on
Returns:

Response JSON parsed from polyswarmd containing emitted events

Schedule an event to execute on a particular block

Parameters:

  • event (Event) – Event to trigger on expiration block
  • chain (str) – Which chain to operate on
